citations.narrative:
A group of 5 cattle are housed in an outdoor pen that has a large water receptacle/stock tank at the front corner of the pen
and there are also 2 twenty-gallon water buckets located under the large shade tree where the animals congregate/gather
during the summer. The large water receptacle was noted to be dirty, and the water was green in color with particulate
material. According to facility personnel, the large receptacle is cleaned out once a week and the 2 water buckets are
cleaned and filled daily.
Per this Section, all water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary. Although the cattle are provided with access to
multiple water receptacles, all water receptacles in an enclosure should be kept clean and contain clean water for the
health and comfort of the animals. The research facility corrected this item during the inspection by cleaning out the large
water receptacle/stock tank and refilling it with fresh water. To remain corrected from this date 7/30/25 forward.
This inspection was conducted with facility representatives 7/29/25 and 7/30/25. The exit briefing was held 7/30/25.
*END OF REPORT*
